data.prayer: Spirit, guide someone in the church in the state of Sharjah to a person ready to receive the message of the gospel, like Lydia, and who will then open her home to faith.
data.verse: One of those listening was a woman from the city of Thyatira named Lydia, a dealer in purple cloth. She was a worshiper of God. The Lord opened her heart to respond to Paul’s message.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Sharjah, United Arab Emirates
data.section_summary: What people or resources could you pray for in this photo?

data.prayer: God, we pray for the believers in Sharjah, United Arab Emirates to be generous so that they would be worthy of greater investment by you.
Lord, raise up apostolic workers to plant churches in every town in the state of Sharjah.
data.verse: The reason I left you in Crete was that you might put in order what was left unfinished and appoint elders in every town, as I directed you.

data.prayer: Father, move the 15,089 believers in the state of Sharjah to say "Not our will, but yours be done", like Jesus.
data.verse: He withdrew about a stone’s throw beyond them, knelt down and prayed, "Father, if you are willing, take this cup from me; yet not my will, but yours be done."

data.prayer: Jesus, I pray that all the Arab, Libyan people will remember and turn to you, Lord God. May all the Arab, Libyan people worship before you. For the kingdom of the Arab, Libyan people is yours.
Lord, teach the disciples in the state of Sharjah to trust your Word, like a lamp, in the darkness around them.
data.verse: your Word is a lamp for my feet, a light on my path.

data.prayer: Spirit, please convict the believers in Sharjah, United Arab Emirates to not assume the ministry is for professional clergy, but for all who have been called by you.
Father, please give the church in the state of Sharjah prophets who can build up holiness and faithfulness to you.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up
